lom:description.lom:string:
"This report identifies major issues and challenges in computer science education across a wide range of institutions. It includes suggestions for improving the quality and effectiveness of computer science and engineering education at the undergraduate, graduate, and K-12 levels. It argues strongly for the creation of a Resource Center for the development and distribution of computer science and engineering curricular materials, educational tools, and other support that could be shared by many institutions." Table of Contents: Contents
1. Introduction 2. Background 3. Areas of concern in CS&E education 3.1. General curriculum issues 3.2. Undergraduate education 3.3. Graduate education 3.4. K-12 education 3.5. Coordination within the education community 4. Creating a center for CS&E education Education Working Group Members References
Published in: ACM Computing Surveys 28(4), December 1996. Copyright Â© 1996 by the Association for Computing Machinery, Inc.
Keywords: Computer and Information Science Education

lom:title.lom:string: Strategic Directions in Computer Science Education
